definition: to follow bad examples/to be corrupted by bad examples
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: Never understand Mei often night he worries that its bad-men go to, and advice, to provoke mei dissatisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 梅常夜归，玥担心其学坏而劝告，惹梅不满。

sentences.english: You cannot open a book without learning something.
sentences.chinese: 学好千日不足，学坏一时有余。

sentences.english: Emboli in the Zhao Fu soon learn bad, mercenary and sensual.
sentences.chinese: 栓子在赵府很快学坏，贪财好色。

sentences.english: These films are likely to deprave the children.
sentences.chinese: 那些影片会使孩子们学坏。

sentences.english: It's just that, in the past, they have lacked confidence or opportunity to stray.
sentences.chinese: 只是在过去，她们缺少“学坏”的信心或者机会。

sentences.english: I am a great friend to public amusements; for they keep people from vice.
sentences.chinese: 我非常支持公共娱乐活动，它会防止人们学坏。

sentences.english: Those who eat best and drink best often do worst.
sentences.chinese: 只图吃好穿好，学坏常常免不了。

sentences.english: They will learn to be bad, more people also want to follow bad.
sentences.chinese: 他们学坏了，还想让更多的人也跟着学坏。

sentences.english: They will learn to be bad, more people also want to follow bad.
sentences.chinese: 他们学坏了，还想让更多的人也跟着学坏。

definition: to mend one's ways (idiom)/to turn over a new leaf
to make a mess/to mess with/to be wild/to sleep around/to jump into bed
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
those who handle cinnabar are stained red; those who work with ink are stained black (idiom)/you are the product of your environment
pinyin: jin4 zhu1 zhe3 chi4 , jin4 mo4 zhe3 hei1

definition: to hang around/to fool around/to live aimlessly
It is hard to change one's essential nature (idiom). You can't change who you are./Can the leopard change his spots? (Jeremiah 13:23)
